product_name: KVD BeautyGood Apple Full-Coverage Transfer-Proof Serum Foundation
summary: SummaryKVD Beauty's Good Apple Full-Coverage Transfer-Proof Serum Foundation covers everything from blemishes to acne scars to hyperpigmentation, all while visibly blurring pores. Best for combo/oily & acne-prone skin, the extreme long-wear formula controls shine all day & stands up to sweat and humidity.
details: DetailsBenefitsSweat & humidity-resistantBlurs pores & keeps shine in check all dayFlexible Elastomer Pigments bend with your skin for a seamless finishNon-comedogenicLightweight & flashback-freeComes in a luxe recyclable glass bottle100% veganFeatures100% of users agree that this foundation is easy to apply*100% of users agree that this foundation has a shine-free finish*93% of users agree that this foundation feels lightweight on skin**In a consumer study on 30 volunteers, immediately after applicationKey IngredientsQuince leaf extract helps reduce shineNourishing apple extract & glycerin help keep skin looking freshItem 2604575How To UseWhen you try, let it dry: This foundation's shades look different when wet vs. fully dry because of the high percent of pigment and ingredients that help provide the extreme long wear. When you pick your shade, make sure to let it dry down completely to see the true color of the pigments.Find Your Match:Check out the undertone descriptors and dry swatch photos to find your best matchDon't judge the shade by the bottle - most shades look deeper when fully dried down to the true colorFully Custom Coverage:Shake well before each useUse a sponge to tap Good Apple into skin and build up to whatever level of coverage you wantUse a dense foundation brush with a buffing motion for more immediate full coveragePump It Up:Start with 1 pea-size drop for buildable full coverageUse a full pump to add even more coverage; a little goes a long wayPrep & Set:Have enlarged pores? Try pressing Lock-It Pore-Refining Primer (sold separately) into skin before applying your foundation, focusing on areas where your pores are most visible.Got oily areas? Lightly dust on Lock-It Setting Powder (sold separately) for a blurred, silky-smooth finish.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Dimethicone, Isododecane, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Glycerin, Cetyl Peg/PPG-10/1 Dimethicone, Pyrus Malus (Apple) Fruit Extract, Cydonia Oblonga Leaf Extract, Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol, Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Silica, Sodium Chloride, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Magnesium Sulfate, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Benzoic Acid, C24-28 Alkyl Methicone, Dehydroacetic Acid, Propylene Carbonate, Potassium Sorbate, Citric Acid, Sodium Benzoate, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Tocopherol, Aluminum Hydroxide, Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: When you try, let it dry: This foundation's shades look different when wet vs. fully dry because of the high percent of pigment and ingredients that help provide the extreme long wear. When you pick your shade, make sure to let it dry down completely to see the true color of the pigments.Find Your Match:Check out the undertone descriptors and dry swatch photos to find your best matchDon't judge the shade by the bottle - most shades look deeper when fully dried down to the true colorFully Custom Coverage:Shake well before each useUse a sponge to tap Good Apple into skin and build up to whatever level of coverage you wantUse a dense foundation brush with a buffing motion for more immediate full coveragePump It Up:Start with 1 pea-size drop for buildable full coverageUse a full pump to add even more coverage; a little goes a long wayPrep & Set:Have enlarged pores? Try pressing Lock-It Pore-Refining Primer (sold separately) into skin before applying your foundation, focusing on areas where your pores are most visible.Got oily areas? Lightly dust on Lock-It Setting Powder (sold separately) for a blurred, silky-smooth finish.

reviews.headline: I definitely like this and will buy again.
reviews.comments: Color is perfect,  doesnt look fake and blends well.

reviews.headline: the best!!!!!
reviews.comments: the best foundation ever!!!!! it makes me look like i am wearing nothing and my skin is clear and glowing, a little bit goes a long way, also its a perfect match.

reviews.headline: Light, Great Coverage!
reviews.comments: I really like this foundation, it is so pretty!! Lovely!! I like it so much, I bought another bottle just in case  they discontinue this. And the match was perfect! Transfer proof-check, sweat proof, check, and it feels so light on my face. I will be buying this again for sure!

reviews.headline: Excellent Foundation!!
reviews.comments: This foundation to so good. I'd put it one par with Estee Lauder Double Wear. Similar but better. Looks like skin. Super light weight and give full coverage. Can't imagine what other didnt like about it.

reviews.headline: LOVE
reviews.comments: The best foundation I've used ever. It has a skin like look and blends perfectly. You can also build on top of it really nicely. I use it for stage make up so I put a lot of layers on top and it works very nicely.

reviews.headline: Cakey 30 mins after application
reviews.comments: I was so let down by this foundation. I thought it would be a good fit for me since its a full coverage foundation that is supposed to feel like a serum. But it ended up looking cakey almost immediately, and 30 mins later it began to separate badly in my nose. It just looked horrible. I've tried changing up my primer, powder, etc and it's still the same. I really wanted to love it since it is full coverage, but at what cost? I cant wear it at all because I work high-end retail sales, and how I present myself at work is important. Super disappointing. I've never had this issue with a foundation before.

reviews.headline: Best foundation for mature skin and long wear
reviews.comments: I keep trying other foundations but come back to this one because it has serum so not drying for mature skin is full coverage and long wearing!

reviews.headline: The oxidization is ridiculous
reviews.comments: Very full coverage anx decent lasting power but the foundation oxidizes like crazy, smh eventually with time making the foundation color a lot darker than when you first apply it.

reviews.headline: not sure it was watery this time they sold me watered down
reviews.comments: I have used it before and it was great but when I ordered off line and it was delivered it was like very watery.

reviews.headline: It's a no for me
reviews.comments: I want to love this foundation but i cannot. First hour it was so pretty but it started to seperate my second and my 3rd hour wearing it. I thought it didnt like my primer so I switched to moisturizer but it still seperated. 6 hours in, some part of my face still intact but the area of my nose, cheeks and mouth already doesnt have foundation. I come to know this foundation doesnt like my cream products as it will moves around i have to keep trying to cover it up. It's a mess

reviews.headline: Not a good match
reviews.comments: Did match on line face rec. and very yellow so have to blend and bronze

reviews.headline: Full coverage
reviews.comments: If your looking for full coverage natural looking foundation buy it! Its thick and buildable foundation so apply as you need it

reviews.headline: I Can't Even
reviews.comments: Doesn't settle in my fine lines but definitely emphasizes my pores. I can't even give this a fair wear test because it's so frustrating to get it out of my tools. I used my brush cleaner, two different cleansing oils, and scrubbed for 30 minutes. I'm still not even sure if it came out of my foundation brush

reviews.headline: Miss urban decay  all nighter
reviews.comments: Unfortunately  this is nowhere near as good as urban decay all nighter foundation, i miss it so much..it was full coverage that lasts all day for me, this one doesn't last at all on me ..i keep spending money trying to find something like the urban decay

reviews.headline: Pretty good
reviews.comments: Foundation is great! I give it a 4 because it is not teven remotely transfer proof! But if it looks good on the skin then I can live with that!

reviews.headline: MY FAV
reviews.comments: This is the perfect foundation for the girls that want full coverage but not a thick or cakey feel! This literally leaves your skin looking flawless & smooth! Love it so much!

reviews.headline: I love it
reviews.comments: It's awesome lightweight and goes on smoothly and it doesn't feel caked on.

reviews.headline: Good coverage
reviews.comments: I received a free sample of this and was impressed by thr coverage without it feeling heavy or looking caked on. It blends well with a brush and a little goes a long way. The color does oxidize so it helps to test it. I used the find my shade feature on the Ulta site based on another foundation I use and it matched it perfectly. I tested it at the store just to be sure as well.

reviews.headline: My New Favorite
reviews.comments: It blends so perfectly with my skin, it doesnt look like i'm wearing makeup. It's very lightweight, but the coverage is fantastic.

reviews.headline: Love KVD Products
reviews.comments: I tried this foundation, Its wonderful if you like full coverage. For myself i don't need much coverage I just like a little color. I found it to be to cakey and thick so I returned it, Not for me.I like tinted BB cream. But i love all the eye colors and powders they have. Top Tier!!!!

media.headline: I would buy this again
media.caption: I wear a 57 at night n lighter in the day love it.

faceoff_positive.comments: I have been on the hunt for a foundation that has good coverage and does not transfer.  I was a long-time user of Estee Lauder's Double Wear; however, it started to really dry my skin out, and in turn, exacerbate my dry patches when I would wear makeup.  I've tried others with claims of being transfer proof, and that was the only one I had tried that lived up to the claim.  As an active girly who gets dirty and sweats, I still like my foundation to stay in place and not slide everywhere or transfer onto my clothes when my face/neck sweats.  I had high hopes for this foundation, and I honestly was not disappointed!  I applied this with a flat foundation brush and worked in small sections on my face because matte foundations have a tendency to dry down faster in my opinion.  The coverage for me was medium to full, and it was easily buildable on the areas I wanted extra coverage.  I picked the 033 medium light because, based on other reviews, the foundation dries down darker.  I am normally a straight medium and prefer neutral tones, and when this dried down, it was a PERFECT match!  It layered over my skincare products and primer nicely, and I thought other makeup products sat nicely on it without disturbing the foundation.  I hate when I like a foundation and other products disturb it by making it patchy or muddying it, but this one did well!  I put the foundation to the test by going to a 3 hour gym sweat sesh, and I can honestly say it looked just as good as when I first applied it.  I did not set it with a powder or a setting spray because I wanted to see if this was legit transfer proof on its own.  While it was still mostly matte by the end of the workout, I could still see some glow underneath, which I also really liked!  It looked very natural.  I felt it was very light on the skin compared to my tried and true Double Wear, and with spring and summer around the corner, I can see me reaching for this more.  At the end of the night, my face still looked good, and it did hold up to its claim of being transfer proof, even without setting powder or spray.  This was my first and only time using this foundation so far, but I look forward to using it more and seeing how it stacks up in the summer!
faceoff_positive.headline: Pleasantly Surprised!

faceoff_negative.comments:
After reviewing this product every day for the last 3 weeks, I have mixed feelings about it. I agree with the claims that it is full coverage and meant for more oily combination skin types. However, I found that it could work for those who have a drier skin type. I have been using acne cleaners and solutions for my hormonal acne, so my skin lately has been on the drier side; but I normally have oily combo skin. When I prep my skin very well this foundation looks great. I found that it paired very well with my Tatcha Dewy Skin Cream on those days where my skin was super dry. It made the foundation have more of a satin finish and it looked beautiful. On the flip side, I had to do a lot of trial and error with this foundation because it did not mix well with my skin care routine, moisturizers, primers, etc. I will attach a photo for reference. I would do my normal routine: apply the primer (which is a great primer), add the foundation, and complete my makeup. Through out the day it would "flake" or peel up and it looked horrible! I found that with this foundation I can only pair it with the primer and my Tatcha moisturizer, anything else will not set well with it. The foundation itself is very full coverage and you do not need a lot. You do need to work fast with this foundation or work in smaller areas because it dries down quick! I work in the hospital setting where I still have to wear a mask and overall the transfer proof claim is legitimate. There is a tiny, tiny bit of transfer but overall great. Again, love-hate relationship with this foundation. When I can make it work I love the way it looks, but when it doesn't mix well with other products it peels off and looks terrible. 
-Attached are two photos; one where it peels and one in natural lighting. They are natural, non filtered photos.
faceoff_negative.headline: Mixed Feelings

rollup.name: Good Apple Full-Coverage Transfer-Proof Serum Foundation
